page.title: 09INDUSTRY
page.content: Until the end of the 1939-45 war the area was mainly engaged in{mining, {quarrying, brick and tile making. The centre of the area is the 250 acre {Industrial Estate.}This was once a number of small coal pits, but now it contains over 100 units, some quite small, employing only a few people. Some firms make parts for vehicles and metal fasteners, others are storage for beer, cider, steel bars, furniture and joinery. There are{Trading Estates at Dawley Brook and The Wallows. There are several old brick works in the area but these are now mainly used for storing bricks manufactured elsewhere. Although just outside our area, the Round Oak steel works employed many people from this area until it was closed three years ago. Only a few of the unemployed found employment on Trading Estates.
